cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression (forecast to become Tropical Storm)
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW, then N across the east-central Gulf, make landfall over the Florida Big Bend and then accelerate NE across Georgia/South Carolina and offshore into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida through coastal Georgia and South Carolina into southeastern North Carolina
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes — 3-5 inches with locally higher amounts possible
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible but uncertain; surge generally expected <3 ft at Charleston at this stage
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Friday as system passes nearby
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible during high tide, generally 1–3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Friday could total 3–5 in with isolated higher amounts over the tri-county area, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; potential temporary channel restrictions and port operation interruptions tied to heavy rainfall and gusty winds
